page.title: 11Population London Overspill.
page.content: During the 1960's and 70's some families from London were encouraged to leave the capital and start a new life in purpose-built housing estates in various Suffolk towns.Many families were leaving poor,overcrowded housing conditions.The Greater London Council helped pay for the extra housing,health and education facilities needed. At the same time,new industry was encouraged to move into the area to provide employment.Some of the Suffolk towns receiving the Londoners were Brandon, Haverhill,Bury St. Edmunds and Sudbury. The newcomers had an important effect on the population figures of the towns they had come to.For example,the population of the Sudbury/Gt. Cornard area rose by about one quater in twenty years,and East Anglia had the fastest growing population in the country at the time.
